meanings.definition: Serving to improve or make better.
meanings.sent1: The amelioratory changes to the playground equipment made it safer for the children to play.
meanings.sent2: The new medicine had an amelioratory effect on the patient's symptoms.
meanings.sent3: The amelioratory addition of extra cheese to the pizza made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her amelioratory advice acted like a ray of sunshine on his gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The amelioratory music filled the room with a sense of peace and calm.

meanings.sent1: The amelioratory massage helped ease the tension in her shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The amelioratory response from the teacher reassured the worried student.
meanings.sent3: His amelioratory joke made everyone laugh and forget their troubles.
meanings.sent4: The amelioratory rain cooled the hot summer day, bringing relief to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The amelioratory hug from her friend made her feel better instantly.

meanings.definition: Acting to mitigate or lessen negative effects.
meanings.sent1: The amelioratory measures taken by the government helped reduce pollution levels.
meanings.sent2: The amelioratory policies aimed to improve the lives of the less fortunate.
meanings.sent3: The amelioratory magic spell turned the toad back into a prince.
meanings.sent4: Her amelioratory smile brightened the mood in the room, dispelling any tension.
meanings.sent5: The amelioratory solution to the problem saved the day and prevented further issues.
